text: Dalbergia parviflora is a species of liana found in South East Asia. Its name is in Malay and Indonesian, in Thai, and in Vietnamese it is (i.e. "small flowers" as in the scientific name). The heartwood of the plant is lakawood, an aromatic wood used for incense. The genus Dalbergia is placed in the subfamily Faboideae and tribe Dalbergieae; no subspecies are listed in the Catalogue of Life. == References == Bentham G (1860) J.Proc.Linn.Soc.,Bot.4(suppl.):1-134 Synopsis...Dalbergieae Phạm Hoàng Hộ (1999) Cây Cỏ Việt Nam: an Illustrated Flora of Vietnam vol. I publ. Nhà Xuẩt Bản Trẻ, HCMC, VN. ==External links== * parviflora Category:Flora of Indo- China
title: Dalbergia parviflora
